headline: NEM data spotlight: Solar PV generation strikes back with record-breaking month
summary_80w: In August 2025, the final month of Australia’s winter, utility-scale and rooftop solar PV generation in the National Electricity Market (NEM) saw a dramatic 22.5% month-on-month increase to 3,338GWh.

headline: Grid-forming battery storage: ‘Standby consumption will be higher’ says Australia’s AGL
summary_80w: “The speed at which the grid-forming inverters are operating means that standby consumption will be higher,” said Dave Bowly of AGL.

headline: Securing the future of energy storage: Navigating the cybersecurity landscape
summary_80w: Katherine Hutton, product manager of cybersecurity at Fluence, discusses why cybersecurity is critical for battery storage systems and how to navigate this increasingly complex area.

headline: Meridian, Nova finalise JV and financing for 400MW solar PV plant in New Zealand
summary_80w: Meridian Energy and Nova Energy have completed agreements to establish a 50-50 joint venture (JV) to build and operate the 400MW Te Rahui solar PV power plant near Taupō, New Zealand.

headline: Sembcorp to build 86MWp floating solar project on Singapore’s Pandan Reservoir
summary_80w: Sembcorp Solar Singapore has won a tender to develop an 86MWp floating solar PV project on Pandan Reservoir.

headline: A year in review: solar moves centre stage in UK’s decarbonisation goals
summary_80w: The UK’s new Labour government took power last summer, promising a renewable energy revolution, with solar playing a lead role.

headline: CALSSA calls for US$10 million fine for utilities for slow residential solar and storage approval
summary_80w: California's solar and storage association has called for US$10 million fines for PG&E and SCE for failing to approve residential solar and storage projects applications quickly.

headline: Syria signs deal with STE to build 100MW solar PV plant
summary_80w: General Corporation for Electricity Transmission and Distribution has signed a deal with Syrian-Turkish Energy Company (STE) to build a 100MW solar plant in Kafr Behm, Hama Governorate.

headline: Solar Organic to build 10GW solar, battery manufacturing site in Spain
summary_80w: Solar Organic Centro España is planning to build a 10GW solar module and battery manufacturing facility in the Spanish autonomous community of Castilla-La Mancha.

headline: US ITC to pursue investigation on PV cell imports from India, Indonesia and Laos
summary_80w: The US International Trade Commission (ITC) has voted to continue the investigation on imported solar cells from India, Indonesia and Laos.

headline: Utility-scale solar and wind hit a record 47.2% electricity share in Australia’s NEM
summary_80w: Australia’s National Electricity Market (NEM) hit a record high for the combined utility-scale solar PV and wind share in the electricity mix on 30 August.

headline: Chinese battery manufacturer Hithium ships first units from Texas BESS assembly plant
summary_80w: Hithium has shipped the first battery energy storage systems (BESS) manufactured at its new plant in Texas, US.

headline: Multinational consortium agrees to invest US$220 million in solar PV, BESS factory in Egypt
summary_80w: Bahraini, Chinese, Egyptian and Emirati groups have agreed to develop a new manufacturing facility in Egypt.

headline: India’s Sunsure signs 500MWh fixed tariff BESS contract to supply Uttar Pradesh during peaks
summary_80w: Renewable energy solutions provider Sunsure Energy claims to have signed India’s first-ever fixed tariff battery storage offtake contract.

headline: TagEnergy acquires Australian developer ACE Power with 6GW renewables portfolio
summary_80w: Renewables developer and independent power producer (IPP) TagEnergy has acquired Australian developer ACE Power, adding 6GW of renewable energy and storage projects to its portfolio.

headline: Australia launches Capacity Investment Scheme tenders seeking 1.6GW of renewables
summary_80w: Two CIS tenders have opened in Western Australia, seeking 1.6GW of renewable energy generation in the Wholesale Electricity Market (WEM).

headline: Meridian, Nova break ground on 400MW New Zealand solar plant
summary_80w: Meridian Energy and Nova Energy have established a JV to build and operate a 400MW solar plant in Rangitaiki near Taupo in New Zealand.

headline: Neoen switches on 2.2GWh BESS in Western Australia
summary_80w: French independent power producer (IPP) Neoen, which is now fully owned by Canadian investment firm Brookfield, has switched on the second phase of its 560MW/2,240MWh Collie BESS in Western Australia.

headline: JA Solar launches DesertBlue module for desert and semi-arid markets
summary_80w: Chinese module maker JA Solar has launched DesertBlue, a PV module designed for desert and semi-arid regions.

headline: Verano Energy secures financing for 83MW/660MWh solar-plus-storage project in Chile
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Verano Energy has closed a US$204 financing for a 83MW/660MWh solar-plus-storage project in Chile.

headline: UK solar generation hits record 9.91TWh in the first six months of 2025
summary_80w: The first half of 2025 has been the strongest year for UK solar energy generation on record, according to a new report think tank Ember.

headline: kWh Analytics launches new renewable energy insurance cover for severe storms
summary_80w: US-based climate insurance provider kWh Analytics has launched a new renewable energy insurance cover for extreme weather events.

headline: US grid reforms have boosted project agreement rates – Wood Mackenzie
summary_80w: US grid interconnection agreements grew by 33% in 2024, reaching 75GW, with three-quarters signed for solar PV and battery energy storage system (BESS) projects, according to a new report from energy market analyst Wood Mackenzie.

headline: ‘A material shift’: US solar developers respond to stricter ‘start of construction’ rules
summary_80w: PV Tech Premium hears from Renewable Properties and Silicon Ranch about the new 'start of construction' rules for US solar projects.

headline: Hitachi Energy acquires Powin’s remaining stake in power conversion system maker Eks Energy
summary_80w: Hitachi Energy has been successful in its bid to acquire full ownership of Eks Energy, a manufacturer of power conversion systems (PCS).

headline: Capacity Investment Scheme Tenders open, targeting 2.4GWh of energy storage in Western Australia
summary_80w: The Australian government has opened two CIS tenders in Western Australia, targeting 2.4GWh of energy storage and 1.6GW of renewables.

headline: Potentia’s 900MWh BESS site the first to be approved under South Australia’s HRE Act
summary_80w: Potentia Energy, a joint venture co-owned by Enel Green Power and INPEX, has secured the first environmental approval for a grid-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) under South Australia's new Hydrogen and Renewable Energy (HRE) Act.

headline: Thailand launches 280MW floating PV tender
summary_80w: State-owned firm Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand (EGAT) has launched a tender for the construction of a 280MW floating PV (FPV) project.

headline: Egypt to build 4GW solar, 1GWh battery storage manufacturing facility
summary_80w: Bahraini, Chinese, Egyptian and Emirati groups have agreed to develop a new solar and storage manufacturing facility in Egypt

headline: ‘Latin American solar sector stands at a pivotal moment’ – SolarPower Europe
summary_80w: Latin America has the potential to unlock billions in clean energy investment if it aligns national policies with global sustainability goals and investor expectations.

headline: INA Solar breaks ground on 4.5GW solar cell plant in Madhya Pradesh
summary_80w: Indian solar manufacturing firm INA Solar has broken ground on its fourth 4.5GW cell production plant in Narmadapuram, Madhya Pradesh.

headline: US solar could pay ‘tens of billions’ in duties after Biden’s AD/CVD moratorium ruled illegal
summary_80w: US solar companies could potentially pay “tens of billions” of dollars in retroactive duties on products imported from Southeast Asia between June 2022 and June 2024, following a decision from the US Court of International Trade (CIT).

headline: Boviet Solar completes exterior construction of 3GW PV cell plant in North Carolina
summary_80w: Boviet Solar has completed exterior construction work on its 3GW PV cell manufacturing facility in Greenville, Pitt County, North Carolina.

headline: JinkoSolar module sales recover as manufacturing losses worsen

headline: China’s six ministries hold PV symposium, signalling further efforts to bolster industry regulation
summary_80w: Another high-level inter-departmental symposium on the PV industry was held in Beijing last week, which focused on four key areas including low-prices.

headline: Pacific Channel launches Fund V to support 10GW renewables portfolio in New Zealand
summary_80w: Venture capital firm Pacific Channel has launched Fund V, which targets 10GW of solar, wind, and energy storage in New Zealand.

headline: Australia: Pacific Energy claims ‘first’ off-grid solar-plus-storage plant to power NSW mine

headline: CAISO monitoring for ‘detrimental market behaviour’ in BESS Bid Cost Recovery process

headline: PG&E delays recommissioning of California BESS adjacent to fire-hit Moss Landing project to next year

headline: California and Texas ‘remain the most stable profiles’ for battery storage asset owners
summary_80w: California and Texas have been “really good proving grounds” for energy storage, according to the CEO of developer Fullmark Energy.

headline: MEAG and SMA Altenso partner on 354MWh Germany BESS with ‘next-gen’ inverters
summary_80w: Asset manager MEAG and a subsidiary of inverter specialist SMA have partnered to deploy a 130MW/354MWh BESS in Germany, their second together and one which will deploy 'next-generation' inverters.

headline: EC-funded study progresses battery storage hybridisation of pumped hydro plant in Slovakia
summary_80w: European Commission funding is supporting a project to integrate battery storage at a pumped hydro energy storage (PHES) plant in Slovakia.

headline: Wood Mackenzie: ‘Australia is a leading country for grid-forming BESS’
summary_80w: “Australia is one of the leading countries for grid-forming inverters,” said Natalie Thompson, senior analyst of energy storage and solar at Wood Mackenzie, when discussing the Australian energy storage market.

headline: TagEnergy acquires ACE Power, adding 6GW of energy storage and renewables in Australia
summary_80w: Renewables developer and independent power producer (IPP) TagEnergy has acquired Australian developer ACE Power, adding 6GW of energy storage and renewables projects to its portfolio.

headline: Pacifico, Zenith Volts and Fermi America propose gigawatt-scale energy solutions with BESS to feed US data centres
summary_80w: Three companies, Pacifico Energy, Zenith Volts, and Fermi America have begun expanding power generation and energy storage capabilities for US data centre development.

headline: ‘US solar manufacturing is at a crossroads’
summary_80w: American Clean Power Association’s MJ Shiao assesses the state of US PV manufacturing in the wake of recent policy developments.

headline: RP Global breaks ground on 50MWp solar project at former German lignite mine

headline: New Jersey to seek 3GW community solar by 2029 with new legislation

headline: One high-quality dataset is enough: Rethinking common data practices in PV projects
summary_80w: Solargis' Marcel Suri reports on the mixing of datasets in solar project planning to artificially enhance financial attractiveness.

headline: Statkraft sells 120MWp Netherlands solar portfolio to Greenchoice
summary_80w: Norwegian energy company Statkraft has sold its Netherlands solar portfolio of 120MWp to Dutch renewable energy supplier Greenchoice.

headline: Noria starts construction at first US floating solar project to use trackers

headline: US solar market must think in ‘years and decades’ amid ‘complicated’ supply challenges – ACP
summary_80w: Long-term procurement decisions from the US solar industry could support US solar manufacturing, regardless of changes to federal tax credits, PV Tech has heard.

headline: FTC Solar, Levona Renewables sign 1GW PV tracker supply agreement

headline: Ferrovial to build 250MW solar PV facility in Texas

headline: Harmony Energy CEO on lessons learned from HEIT, strategy going forward and European expansion

headline: California’s Orange County is latest jurisdiction to introduce new BESS zoning standards

headline: Lithuania’s capex support scheme to help fund 4,000MWh of energy storage
summary_80w: An EU-backed energy storage capex support scheme in Lithuania will support as much as 4,000MWh of battery storage, the Ministry of Energy has said.

headline: ‘BESS ownership typically changes hands 2-4 times during a 40-year lifecycle,’ says Pottinger
summary_80w: “Battery energy storage systems (BESS) typically change ownership between two and four times during their 40-year lifecycle,” John Sheehy, CEO of Pottinger, said on day two of the Battery Asset Management Summit Australia 2025 this morning.

headline: Gigawatt-hour-scale ‘Energy Parks’ BESS developer Pacific Green raises AU$77 million for Australia projects
summary_80w: BESS developer Pacific Green Technologies has secured a AU$77 million (US$49.9 million) debt facility for projects in Australia.

headline: Australia approves 797MW of renewable capacity in July

headline: Neoen and NHOA partner on BESS with capacity market contract in North Italy
summary_80w: IPP Neoen has enlisted BESS supplier NHOA Energy for its first energy storage project in Italy.

headline: ABO Energy closes US$279.8 million loan to fund renewable projects

headline: Daqo losses stabilise as polysilicon production exceeds sales for the first time this year
summary_80w: Daqo New Energy has posted gross losses of US$81.4 million in Q2 2025, up from losses of US$81.5 million in Q1.

headline: Utility-scale PV investment drops and small-scale soars in first half of 2025 – BloombergNEF

headline: Jakson Engineers invests US$912.5 million in 6GW integrated PV manufacturing plant
summary_80w: Jakson Engineers is investing over INR80 billion (US$912.5 million) to set up a 6GW integrated solar module, cell, and wafer plant.

headline: India adds 14.3GW utility-scale solar in H1 2025, up 49% year-on-year
summary_80w: India installed 14.3GW of new utility-scale solar capacity in the first half (H1) of 2025, marking a 49% increase year-on-year.

headline: Bila Solar, Origami Solar to offer steel-framed US-made PERC modules

headline: Gentari, Gamuda to build 1.5GW solar-plus-storage to power data centres in Malaysia
summary_80w: Malaysian clean energy solutions company Gentari Renewables has partnered with Malaysian engineering and infrastructure giant Gamuda to build a solar-plus-storage portfolio in their home country.

headline: Ember: African imports of Chinese solar panels increase 60% year-on-year to over 15GW
summary_80w: Africa imported over 15GW of panels from China in the 12 months to June 2025, a 60% increase over the imports recorded in the prior year.

headline: China added 11GW of new PV capacity in July, down 48% year-on-year
summary_80w: China has added 11.04GW of solar PV capacity in July 2025, a 48% decrease from the same period a year ago, according to data from China's National Energy Administration.

headline: New Jersey Governor signs laws to increase energy storage and community solar installations
summary_80w: Governor of New Jersey, US, Phil Murphy, signed legislation into law to reach 2,000MW of energy storage capacity by 2030, and nearly doubling the state’s clean energy capacity.

headline: Megawatts are not enough anymore for leading US BESS markets
summary_80w: After an initial rush to deploy that gave CAISO and ERCOT the lead in US BESS adoption, both markets are focused on capacity and availability, writes Amit Mathrani of Rabobank Americas.

headline: New EU end-of-life battery regulations create legal and commercial complexities for suppliers
summary_80w: Suriya Edwards and Deborah Harvey, partners specialising in battery energy storage at law firm Freeths LLP, analyse new EU battery regulations around suppliers' responsibility for collecting, treating and recycling collected batteries.

headline: Australia: Capacity Investment Scheme results for 16GWh tender expected ‘in the coming weeks’
summary_80w: “We’re expecting the results of the Capacity Investment Scheme (CIS) Tender 3 in the coming weeks,” Thimo Mueller, general manager, commercial at ASL, said in the opening keynote of the Battery Asset Management Summit Australia 2025 this morning.

headline: New community batteries launch in Queensland and Victoria, Australia

headline: AEMO: BESS secures the highest reliability amongst clean energy technologies in Australia
summary_80w: The Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) has found battery energy storage systems (BESS) are the most reliable clean energy technology in the National Electricity Market (NEM).

summary_80w: China continued to drive global grid-scale BESS commissioning activity in July, as the technology approaches the global installed gigawatt (GW) capacity of pumped hydro.

headline: R.Power to sell 440MW ready-to-build PV portfolio in Poland
summary_80w: Polish independent power producer (IPP) R.Power plans to sell a 440MW ready-to-build PV portfolio in its home country.

headline: Tariffs and AD/CVD ‘not welcome news’ say experts, as India treads the murky US markets

headline: ACWA Power commissions 2.7GW Saudi PV portfolio

headline: US ROUNDUP: Energy Vault, Richardson and Fluence make strategic supply chain moves
summary_80w: Three companies, Energy Vault, Richardson Electronics, and Fluence, have made strategic moves to create a secure BESS equipment supply chain.

headline: Iberdrola hires Ingeteam for 100MW/200MWh BESS hybridisation of PV plants in Spain
summary_80w: Spanish utility Iberdrola and power conversion specialist firm Ingeteam have partnered to hybridise Spanish operational PV plants with battery energy storage systems (BESS).

headline: State-owned utility commissions five new community batteries in Western Australia

headline: Threshold projects scrapped, higher PPA prices, FEOC uncertainty: Life as a US BESS developer-operator post-OBBB
summary_80w: What does Trump's tax reconciliation bill mean for US solar and BESS project development and construction right now? We hear from developer-operator Agilitas Energy CEO Barrett Bilotta.

summary_80w: Two North American companies, Powin and Li-Cycle, were recently acquired by FlexGen and Glencore, respectively, after announcing bankruptcy.

headline: Ultra-low cost battery storage launch provokes price war discussion at Shanghai trade show
summary_80w: A product launch at this year's EESA Energy Storage Exhibition in China drew attention, discussion and even disbelief, reports Carrie Xiao.

headline: Statera brings online UK’s biggest battery storage project to date

summary_80w: ACE Power has confirmed the sale of the 103MW/206MWh Kerang grid-forming BESS in the Loddon Valley region of Victoria, Australia.

headline: Akaysha Energy: Developing the ‘world’s most powerful battery storage system’
summary_80w: “It’s the most powerful BESS in the world,” Nick Carter of Akaysha Energy, tells ESN Premium after switching on the Waratah Super Battery in New South Wales, Australia.

headline: Fluence opens 35GWh utility-scale battery storage system manufacturing facility in Vietnam
summary_80w: Global energy storage technology and energy software services provider Fluence and ACE Engineering have opened a new automated battery storage manufacturing facility in Vietnam's Bac Giang Province.

summary_80w: CATL has partnered with renewable energy developer ACEnergy to supply 3GWh of battery energy storage systems (BESS) in Australia.

headline: Don’t miss the moment: Why we must scale long-duration energy storage now
summary_80w: Now is the moment for long-duration energy storage to become a key pillar of the energy transition, writes LDES Council CEO Julia Souder.

headline: Infrastructure solutions provider DS1 begins installing 30MW/60MWh CATL BESS in Lithuania
summary_80w: Construction has begun in western Lithuania on a 30MW/60MWh grid-connected battery energy storage system (BESS) project using CATL equipment.
